Message.Title: When God Made the Numbers Some Were Not Satisfied
Message.Msg: When God made the numbers some were made real, some imaginary, some integers, some fractions, some rationals, some irrationals, etc. Some of the irrationals protested their status and demanded that they be included as part of the integers. They argued that it was their right to be called integers and excluding them from the integers was discriminatory. It was pointed out to the irrationals that including them with the integers was logically impossible, that the very essence of the integers precluded their being irrationals and the very essence of the irrationals precluded them from being integers. The irrationals said that none of that mattered, that they wanted to be integers, it was their right, and any opposition was obviously motivated by numerophobia. They vowed to take their case to the courts where they had arranged to have many dishonest friends. Well, no one can say how the court cases will come out or how much success the irrationals may have persuading people to support their point of view (government education being what it is), but one thing is tautologically certain: the irrationals will never actually be integers.

Topic.Title: When God Made the Numbers Some Were Not Satisfied

After a time professors would explain to students that irrationals use to mean the uncountable set but now the convention changed. Words are only symbols created by man and modifiable by man.

Topic.Title: Microsoft stock is the worst performing stock with a market cap of over 200 billion!

Message.Msg: Why would "relat[ing] to the youth" be the criterion? The CEO needs a deep understanding of the art of computing and how people in general relate to it. Given that, he/she could make sound judgments about what is a good product that people will want. Given that, a little company run by Steve Jobs was able to run circles around Microsoft, beginning in a state of near-bankruptcy, despite all the supposed advantages Microsoft had. Arguably Microsoft's "advantages" are actually millstones hung around its neck, and the future belongs to those who can start from scratch today with no baggage at all.
